Text.Value: Did you hear that noise? The flames? I knew these refugees were up to no good. I knew it.
Oh. Another 'visitor', I see. Listen, we keep letting the likes of you in, soon there'll be no room left for any of us true Baldurians!
Excuse me? I was born inside the city walls - a Baldurian through and through!
I'll have you know I was born and bred in Baldur's Gate. My Father practically owns this place.
I'll have you know I was born and bred in Baldur's Gate.
Someone's added explosives to toys meant for refugees. Sound familiar?
Now I've heard you speak, that's very apparent. Please, stop wasting my time.
Someone's added explosives to toys meant for refugees. Sound familiar?
I thought cities were supposed to welcome folk of all walks of life. Clearly I was mistaken.
Ah - have you returned to fight the good fight? Always room for one more!

EditorData.NodeContext: Hoping the player might see things from his perspective/rally to him

Text.Value: YOU! You're a true Baldurian, I can tell. You must understand why we need to keep these strays out of our city.

EditorData.NodeContext: Try to rally the player to his cause

Text.Value: Refugees aren't 'strays'. They are people, and they need help.
Baldurians! Stand with me against this tide that threatens to overwhelm us.
Exactly! Out with these interlopers, I say.
What exactly are you implying? You bleeding hearts are always painting us as monsters - We don't want them dead.
The Flaming Fists are supposed to protect this good city, but they allow trash and vermin to take our homes and goods!
Your fight is far from good.
I only hope nobody of importance was hurt in the explosion.
Sorry to disappoint you, but I'm actually not a Baldurian.
Yes, friend! We must stand together against these parasites.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pleased the player sees things his way

Text.Value: Baldurian? Your accent's Rivingtonian - that hardly counts.
Another bleeding heart - piss off and take it elsewhere.
Wherever you're from, clearly they don't teach manners.
You and I have nothing more to say to one another.
Well, it was good to speak to a real Baldurian. Makes a change.
Good riddance.
Please just go home - you're ruining a perfectly uneventful posting with this nonsense.

EditorData.NodeContext: Weary/annoyed; trying to wrangle anti-refugee protestors

Text.Value: Leave.
Oh. My apologies - now I hear you speak, I of course realise you're a local.

EditorData.NodeContext: Apologetic (but trying not to sound TOO apologetic to maintain face)

Text.Value: Remind me what the 'fight' is actually about?
It is one's duty to protect those with nothing.
The army on your doorstep will slay Baldurians and refugees alike. You must stand together.
I can only hope we turf them out before they devour all our food like locusts.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pleased the player sees things his way/triumphant

Text.Value: Baldur's Gate is the most diverse city in all of Faern. We should take them in with pride.
I know an outsider when I see one - you've probably never even heard of the Upper City, let alone been there.
I'm a born and bred Baldurian, how dare you!
I should be leaving.
We just want Baldur's Gate to be for Baldurians. Let Waterdeep give this riffraff shelter.

Synopsis: The small dialog for the local anti-refugee protesters leader.
